conclusion: Analyze the motion of the particle based on the v-t graph to determine scenarios where the particle passes through a position three times.
The v-t graph shows velocity as a function of time, symmetric about a dashed line.
From t = 0 to the dashed line, velocity decreases from positive to zero.
From the dashed line to t = t1, velocity increases from zero to the same positive value.
The position x(t) can be found by integrating the velocity v(t).
The position function will exhibit symmetry due to the symmetric velocity.
From t = 0 to the dashed line, the particle moves forward but slows down.
At the dashed line, the particle momentarily stops.
From the dashed line to t = t1, the particle moves forward again, accelerating.
Denote the time at the dashed line as tm; position function characteristics are x(0) = x0, x(tm) = xm, x(t1) = x0.
For the particle to pass through a position three times, x(t) must intersect a horizontal line three times.
The particle starts at x0, moves to xm, and returns to x0.
For three intersections, the position must be between x0 and xm.
Conclusion: The particle passes through a position between x0 and xm three times.
